result.execSummary:
The defendant Travis D Westaby was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

AND 14CM418, 14CM419, 14CF280, 14CF329, 14CF379, 15CF18, 14CF281, 14CF282 AND several TR cases. Defendant, Travis D Westaby with Attorney Julie A. Weber appeared.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew John Maki.  Janell Evan - Clerk.  8:38 am

COURT:  addresses defendants request for new counsel.  Public Defenders office will not appoint new counsel.  
Defendant states that he did not know anything about a plea agreement.  Has been talking with his parents about hiring an attorney.
COURT:  advises defendant that he may forfeit his right to attorney by being uncooperative.   Questions defendant about his understanding of each case and the potential penalties.  

State argues that no reason has been stated that would require Ms. Weber to be removed.

COURT:  has heard nothing that would indicate Ms. Weber should be removed from case.  Finds def does not want to represent himself and has no ability to do so.  Finds def is very vague about hiring counsel and does not have another attorney ready to take over his cases.  Finds defs request a delay tactic.  **Will not allow Atty. Weber to w/draw.**  Finds there is ample time to prepare for trial on 14CF281 and 14CF282 whilch are scheduled on Jan. 11, 2016 and Jan. 12, 2016

14CF261 is rescheduled for JT.  Motions, voir dire, etc by 2-24-16

14CF281 and 14CF282  Jury trials to remain on the calendar.  
All other cases to tag along
